page.title: 07REETH FOLK MUSEUM
page.content: Mr &Mrs Donald Law created the folk museum in 1974.The building had previously been the Methodist Sunday School,and had originally been the Methodist day school founded in 1834.It took Mr&Mrs Law three years to collect items fo the museum and they have been adding to their collection ever since.The museum has a good collection of{Lead mining}equipment as well as{antique farming}implements.Mr Law's favourite item is{a Bible in a} {Bible box.}It is the oldest thing in the musuem, dated 1634.They estimate that about 15,000 people visit the museum every year, with up to 150 people a day in the summer season. We think that the museum provides a very good reflection of what it must have been like to live in Swaledale before the turn of the century.
